results.title: Renal tumours in a Tsc1+/- mouse model show epigenetic suppression of organic cation transporters Slc22a1, Slc22a2 and Slc22a3, and do not respond to metformin.
results.text_hl: These observations suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ could have therapeutic potential for @DISEASE_Tuberous_Sclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D014402 @@@tuberous sclerosis@@@, an @<m>DISEASE_Genetic_Diseases_Inborn</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D030342 @@@inherited disorder@@@ characterised by the aberrant activation of mTORC1 and the development of @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumours@@@ in many organs, including the kidneys.

citations.NLM: Yang J, Kalogerou M, Gallacher J, Sampson JR, Shen MH. Renal tumours in a Tsc1+/- mouse model show epigenetic suppression of organic cation transporters Slc22a1, Slc22a2 and Slc22a3, and do not respond to metformin. Eur J Cancer. 2013 Apr;49(6):1479-90. PMID: 23228442
citations.BibTeX: @article{23228442, title={Renal tumours in a Tsc1+/- mouse model show epigenetic suppression of organic cation transporters Slc22a1, Slc22a2 and Slc22a3, and do not respond to metformin.}, author={Yang J and Kalogerou M and Gallacher J and Sampson JR and Shen MH}, journal={Eur J Cancer}, volume={49}, number={6}, pages={1479-90}}

results.title: The Genomic Landscape of Renal Oncocytoma Identifies a Metabolic Barrier to Tumorigenesis
results.text_hl: This suggests that the @<m>DISEASE_Genetic_Diseases_Inborn</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D030342 @@@genetic defects@@@ in mitochondria activate a metabolic checkpoint, producing autophagy impairment and @DISEASE_Mitochondrial_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D028361 @@@mitochondrial accumulation@@@ that limit @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ progression, revealing a novel @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@-suppressive mechanism for mitochondrial inhibition with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Joshi S, Tolkunov D, Aviv H, Hakimi AA, Yao M, Hsieh JJ, Ganesan S, Chan CS, White E. The Genomic Landscape of Renal Oncocytoma Identifies a Metabolic Barrier to Tumorigenesis Cell Rep. 2015 Dec 1;13(9):1895-908. PMID: 26655904
